heading: Wednesday Night
text: Mostly cloudy. Rain showers likely early, then diminishing, and possibly mixing with snow late in the northern mountains, and near the international border. Lows in the low to mid 30s. Southwest winds 5 to 15 mph, gusting to 30 mph west of the Greens.

heading: Thursday, Thanksgiving Day
text: Partly to mostly cloudy. Chance of a rain or snow shower north, except scattered to numerous snow showers in the St. Lawrence Valley and Adirondacks, with a trace to 2 inches. Valley highs from the mid 30s to lower 40s. Southwest winds 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 30 mph.

heading: Thursday Night
text: Mostly cloudy. Chance of snow showers northeast, and in the south; snow showers likely from the northern Green Mountains westward, with a trace to 2 inches, except locally higher in the St. Lawrence Valley and Adirondacks. Blustery, with lows in the mid to upper 20s. Southwest winds 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 30 mph.
